column1: European Studies in Investor Relations and Financial Communication MSc
column5: The aim of the Master is to train specialists operating both in the banking sector and in capital markets. Graduated students will be able to bridge information and knowledge gaps between financial experts and investors and entrepreneurs. Moreover, such specialists will be asked to strategically manage a huge amount of information in order to suggest sound investment decisions.CurriculumFirst
column7: European residents: A student may pay from a minimum of about € 3600 (for lower family incomes and cheaper courses) to a maximum of about € 9000 (for higher family incomes and more expensive courses) per year.  Non-European residents: The full tuition fee amount is € 8540 per year.
